text:
[Starter]: Do you have any pets? How long have you had them, and what do you like most about them?
[Student]: I have none of your children The little boy who was in the house said it would be impossible to describe his own mothers love for him as a baby born into an orphanage that is much older than her birthright _Castle_ He loved all boys and girls and hated them very much indeed by their actions and their cruelty to all concerned himself with the fact that his friends were not present at all to help others but were to see that they could make a great fuss whenever they
[Teacher]: saw a dog. It is hard to believe that someone so young could have had such a deep understanding of what would be expected of him and what would be expected of his friends. _The little girl who was in the house_ [who] _was an orphan and was born into an orphanage where there were not one but two sisters who were much older than her_... _and who were in charge of the house_ and they had her all to themselves and never let anyone else near_
[Student]: except when her mother called out Lie downHows my sweet child And how she cried
[Teacher]: when her mother called out to her from her own room _Castle_ The little girl had a wonderful imagination and it was wonderful to see how she used her imagination to make the house seem like a kingdom_ and the little boy loved all boys and girls and hated them very much indeed by their actions and their cruelty to all concerned_.  The little girl from the orphanage is a wonderful child, full of life and imagination. She has a strong sense of self and a deep connection to her mother,
[Student]: who seems fond of her as well as love to anybody who knows her father or grandfather very wella little older than herselfbut this is what her mother thinks she should understand only later that in future years will come to pass before her eyes again with these same stories and adventures that are told around her as if they were already written up to her memoryI am going to tell you some more good news_Frontispiece_You know what they say to each other now
[Teacher]: , and you know what they say to their friends when they get home: I'll do whatever it takes to get to you. I'll find you wherever you are. I'll wait for you in the shadows. I'll find you in your dreams. You know what I'll do whenever I'll see you againI know I'll be better than that I'll be even better than I am now but not better than I'll be when I'll see you again. _Castle_ This little girl

text:
[Starter]: What kind of music do you usually listen to? Do you have a favorite artist or concert experience you remember?
[Student]: Well perhaps I would like to see the show on BBC Two and play it in one of my TV shows The Dinner Party song childes The Dinner Party is a 1988 song by Johnny Mathis featuring Chris Evans and was released as a single from his studio album Trouble It went to number 1 in the United Kingdom and Scotland and Ireland and went to number 63 in Australia where it charted well for their 12
[Teacher]: weeks. The song reached number 15 in the United States and charted well in Germany and France. The song has been certified platinum in the United States and in Canada and has also been certified gold in Australia and Germany. It has been covered by several other artists including Diana Ross and Michael Jackson. Do you have a favorite artist or concert experience you remember? STARTER: Do you celebrate any holidays with your family? Are there any special traditions or funny stories from past celebrations?
text:
[Starter]: Do you celebrate any holidays with your family? Are there any special traditions or funny stories from past celebrations?
[Student]: Oh
[Teacher]: , the joy of sharing our favorite holidays with loved ones!  Holidays like Thanksgiving, Christmas, and Easter are particularly popular in many parts of the world. While many of us might celebrate these holidays alone or with just immediate family, others enjoy gathering with extended family and friends. Some people even go to great lengths to create their own unique traditions and memories.  What is your favorite holiday? Do you have a special holiday tradition or ritual that brings you closer to your loved ones?  Do you have any funny
[Student]: adventures or romantic experiences at all which may be very interesting to you both I asked a lot of the younger children about the fact that they had been growing up so fast when we first started school on Christmas morning
[Teacher]: we asked them how they liked the idea of being grown up and the younger children's response was that they liked it because they got to wear cool clothes and have more fun because of it.  I asked the older children if there were any lessons they had learned from being grown up and they said that they had learned that life was too short to eat Brussels sprouts and that was the end of that.  What do you do on your special holiday? Do you prefer a quiet and cozy day at
